business.headline: What is Mutual Fund Lite? All you need to knowThe aim of the Mutual Fund Lite framework is to simplify the rules for managing passively managed mutual funds.
Sensex, Nifty end flat as banking sector downturn offsets IT surgeThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 33.49 points to end at 84,266.29, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 13.95 points to close at 25,796.90.

RVNL shares down 19% from record high. Good time to buy? RVNL shares have corrected nearly 19% from its record high of Rs 647. Is now a good time to invest in RVNL stock, or should investors wait for clearer signals? Read on to know more.

New life insurance rules from today: What it means for you? As of October 1, policyholders will now be eligible for a guaranteed surrender value from the first year, even if they have only paid one annual premium. However, these new regulations are expected to lower returns for policyholders over time.
Explained: Why Paytm shares jumped over 7% todayAt 2:56 pm, shares of Paytm were trading over 7.02% higher at Rs 736.70 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

This smallcap EV stock is up 38,000% in 5 years. Have you invested? In just a month, the company's shares have gained over 83% and over 168% in a year. In the past five years, the stock has gained a whopping 38,900%.
Who is Tony Vinciquerra, outgoing CEO of Sony Pictures Entertainment?Tony Vinciquerra joined Sony Pictures Entertainment in June 2017 and saw five consecutive years of profit growth
New TDS rates from today: These transactions will be impactedRevised tax rates and TDS changes are now in effect. Here's what taxpayers need to know about the updates.
Who is Ravi Ahuja, the incoming CEO of Sony Pictures?As he steps into the CEO role, Ravi Ahuja will succeed Tony Vinciquerra, who will remain with SPE as a non-executive chairman until December 2025.

Check latest interest rates on PPF, SCSS, SSY and more The post office savings schemes included in this decision are the Public Provident Fund (PPF), Senior Citizen Savings Scheme (SCSS), Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana (SSY), and a few others.

Consumers await fuel price relief as OMCs pocket huge gainsDespite falling crude prices and record profits, consumers are still waiting for meaningful reductions in fuel prices, even as oil marketing companies are reaping huge benefits.

Google pays $2.7 billion to bring back AI visionary Noam ShazeerNoam Shazeer, 48, was one of Google's early hires, joining the company in 2000. A talented software engineer, Shazeer made his mark in AI, becoming a key figure in Google's early AI development.

India's factory growth cools to eight-month low in SeptemberNew orders - a key gauge of demand - grew at the weakest pace since December, though were still robust, while output was at an eight-month low.

Diffusion Engineers IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check statusDiffusion Engineers IPO allotment status: Investors can check their allotment status through the online portals of the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) and Bigshare Services Pvt Ltd, the registrar for the IPO.

Gold, silver price today, October 1, 2024: Precious metals record hike on MCXGold Price Today October 1, 2024: Both gold and silver are trading on the higher side of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Monday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.
Sensex, Nifty open higher as IT and auto stocks gainThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 147.39 points to 84,447.17 at 10:02 am, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 34.75 points to trade at 25,845.60.

New PPF rules effective today: All you need to know New PPF rules effective today streamline account management for minors, multiple account holders, and NRIs, impacting interest rates and regulations.

Stock market changes effective today: 3 things investors need to knowThree key updates effective today will impact transaction fees, Securities Transaction Tax, and share buyback taxation for stock market investors.

Bloodbath on D-Street: Sensex slips 1,200 points; investors lose Rs 4 lakh croreThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 1,272.07 points to 84,299.78 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 361.65 points lower at 25,810.85.

Ola Electric shares slip below Rs 100. Buy the dip or avoid? The stock was down 2.59% at Rs 99.55 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), marking a sharp decline from its record high of Rs 157.53 on August 20, 2024.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Tirupati laddu row: Andhra pauses SIT probe until Supreme Court hearingThe development comes a day after the Supreme Court raised a slew of questions to the Andhra Pradesh government over the Tirupati laddu controversy.

Posing as CBI officials, fake court hearing: How cybercriminals duped SP OswalThe police said the cybercriminals contacted Vardhman Group chairman SP Oswal, claiming to have incriminating documents related to a money laundering case involving him. He was duped into transferring Rs 7 crore to the fraudsters.

Delivery agent killed by customer in Lucknow, body packed into delivery bagA delivery man was killed by a customer and his body was disposed of in a canal in Lucknow. The main accused, along with his accomplices, packed the agent's body into the same bag in which he had delivered phones.

Article 370 removal helps Hindu refugees from Pak create history in J&KA 45-year-old voter, enabled to vote for the first time, answers the question of what did removal of Article 370 achieve. On a red-letter day, Hindu refugees from Pakistan cast their votes in the Jammu and Kashmir election for the first time.

How image of this man shielding son from Israeli fire became symbol of 2nd IntifadaThe heart-wrenching incident, involving Jamal al-Durrah and his son Muhammad in Gaza, became the defining image of the second Palestinian uprising.

Fearless and selfless, captain Rohit Sharma inspires India to another famous winIndia vs Bangladesh: Despite losing two-and-a-half days due to rain, India managed to beat Bangladesh with seven wickets and a session to spare. Rohit Sharma has to be given credit for how India batted without the fear of failure on Monday as they raced against time.

Top Iranian secret service officer was Israeli spy: Iran ex-president's bombshellFormer Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad revealed in an interview that the head of a secret unit tasked with countering Israel's spy agency Mossad's operations in Iran was, in fact, an Israeli agent.

Heart patient in Kerala dies after treatment by failed 2nd year MBBS studentThe Kerala Police arrested an "unqualified" resident medical officer (RMO) following the death of a 60-year-old heart patient at a private hospital in Kozhikode.

Watch: Russian jet flies within feet of US fighter plane off Alaska coastUS Senator Dan Sullivan said that the actions of the Russian fighter jet put the lives of US airmen at risk. The incident took place during the intercept of Russian jets near Alaska last week.

Has Siddaramaiah shot himself in the foot?Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah's wife, BM Parvathi, wrote to Mysuru Urban Development Authority (Muda) to return 14 plots of land that had sparked a huge controversy. However, the letter to Muda might be counterproductive as it is being showcased by the BJP as an "admission of guilt" in the land scam.

Woman bleeds to death after sex, partner arrested for negligenceAccording to the police, the woman went to a hotel with her boyfriend. While the couple were having sex, the woman started bleeding profusely from her private part and became unconscious.

Attack on Constitution: Rahul Gandhi on lavish Ambani weddingAddressing a rally in Haryana's Sonipat, Congress MP Rahul Gandhi said that PM Modi has developed a system where 25 people in India can spend thousands of crores of rupees on their marriage, while farmers and ordinary people have to take loans for getting their children married.

China eyes Western supply chains after Lebanon pager shockThe Chinese side noted that the explosion incident and back-to-back targeted killings triggered serious concerns among consumers in Arab countries about the security of electronic products produced in or whose supply chains are controlled by the West.

Bengaluru Police reacts to viral video of man trying to break into woman's carA Bengaluru woman had a narrow escape when a man tried to break into her car. The police reacted after a video of the incident went viral on social media.

Three factors shaping BJP's campaign in Haryana as it eyes record 3rd termAs the BJP attempts a third consecutive term in Haryana, here are the three key factors shaping the party's campaign in the Jat land.

No scope for reform: Court upholds death penalty of man who fried mother's organsThe accused was awarded a death sentence for killing his 63-year-old mother, mutilating her body, and attempting to cook some of her organs.

Retired IAS officer reveals first salary TCS Mumbai offered him 40 years agoRetired IAS officer Rohit Kumar Singh shared a glimpse of his journey as he revealed his first salary that TCS Mumbai had offered him 40 years ago.

Israel targets Hezbollah strongholds in Lebanon ground raids, blasts in Tel Aviv Live UpdatesAlso on Tuesday, Hezbollah launched an operation to avenge Israel for Hassan Nasrallah's death. The group said it launched missiles at Israel's Gilot base and the Mossad headquarters located in the suburbs of Tel Aviv.

Rajinikanth had swelling in blood vessel, to be discharged in 2 days: HospitalSuperstar Rajinikanth was admitted to a Chennai hospital on Monday after he complained of stomach pain. The hospital has now released a medical bulletin, mentioning that doctors performed a non-surgical procedure to fix a blood vessel connecting to his heart.

Video of nursery teachers dancing to Aaha Tamatar Bade Mazedar divides InternetA video of nursery teachers dancing to the children's rhyme 'Aaha Tamatar Bade Mazedar' went viral on social media.

Siddaramaiah 'surprised' at wife's move to return land: Victim of hate politicsMuda Scam: Siddaramaiah's remarks came after his wife announced that she would return the 14 compensatory land sites that she received from the Mysuru Urban Development Authority in the wake of the land 'scam' probe.

Isro announces launch date of ambitious Venus Orbiter MissionThe venus orbiter Mission aims to study Venus's atmosphere, surface, and geological features using a suite of sophisticated scientific instruments.

Nasrallah suffocated to death from toxic fumes inside bunker: ReportHassan Nasrallah, the elusive chief of Hezbollah who headed the Iran-backed Hezbollah for 32 years, was killed on September 27 in a massive Israeli airstrike that hit the militant group's headquarters in Beirut.

Pic: Hrithik Roshan's sweet anniversary wish for 'partner' Saba Azad Bollywood star Hrithik Roshan shared the sweetest anniversary wish for his girlfriend and actor Saba Azad. Hrithik and Saba have been together for two years now.

Krushna Abhishek updates fans on Govinda's health, says why he couldn't visit Comedian Krushna Abhishek reassured fans about the improving health of his uncle, actor Govinda, who was hospitalised following an accidental gunshot.

Actor Tanushree Dutta on rejecting films offered by #MeToo accused directorsIn an interview recently, actor Tanushree Dutta talked about making sacrifices after being the leading voice behind the #MeToo movement in the film industry.

Thalapathy 69: Bobby Deol in Vijay's last film by H Vinoth, check official posterActor Bobby Deol officially joined Thalapathy Vijay's last film, directed by H Vinoth, on Tuesday, October 1. While nothing about his character was revealed in the announcement, he is reportedly playing the main villain in the film.

sports.headline: Watch: Kohli-Gambhir's embrace highlights India's Kanpur Test win celebrationsStar India batter Virat Kohli and Gautam Gambhir were seen hugging each other after India's seven-wicket win over Bangladesh in the second Test at Green Park, Kanpur.

India inch closer to World Test Championship final berth after Bangladesh winThe Indian team further solidified their position at the top of the World Test Championship standings. They won the series 2-0 against Bangladesh with a 7-wicket win in Kanpur.

Irani Cup: Rahane, Sarfaraz star for Mumbai on hard-fought opening dayIrani Cup 2024: Ajinkya Rahane, Shreyas Iyer and Sarfaraz Khan hit fifties as Mumbai recovered from early trouble to head to Stumps at 237 for 4. Captain Rahane will be looking to make it big and start the domestic season on a high.

Olympic medallist Manu Bhaker to visit Kolkata during Durga Puja 2024Olympic medallist Manu Bhaker is set to experience the grandeur of Durga Puja in Kolkata for the first time since her historic Paris 2024 campaign. The star shooter will also inspire young athletes and promote women's empowerment during her visit.

R Ashwin backs Gill and Jaiswal to be India's pillars in overseas conditions Star India off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin has backed the young batting duo of Shubman Gill and Yashasvi Jaiswal to be India's batting pillars in the overseas conditions.

Ashwin plays down competition with Jadeja for spot in AustraliaRavichandran Ashwin backed Ravindra Jadeja for a spot in the upcoming Australia series, dismissing any competition between them. Watch: Kohli gifts special bat to Shakib al Hasan after Kanpur TestVirat Kohli honored Shakib Al Hasan by gifting him a signed bat after the Kanpur Test, marking what could be Shakib's final Test match. The gesture symbolized respect for Shakib's iconic all-round career.

Ready for 100-all out: Rohit Sharma explains India's Bazball show in Kanpur TestIndia vs Bangladesh: Captain Rohit Sharma said India were prepared to get bowled out for 100 in their first innings as the focus was on scoring quickly and racing against time to produce a favourable result. Despite losing two days to wet weather, India won the Test by seven wickets and a session to spare.

World Test Championship validated as India hunt down Bangladesh in 2 daysIndia raced to a 7-wicket win against Bangladesh in the Kanpur Test match, despite no play possible for two straight days. One can argue that India's hunt for a win against BAN was a direct result of the exciting World Test Championship format.

Ashwin reveals how Rohit Sharma plotted Kanpur Test heist on Day 4India vs Bangladesh: R Ashwin revealed how captain Rohit Sharma plotted Bangladesh's downfall in the Kanpur Test after two days were washed out due to rain and a wet outfield.

Watch: Rohit Sharma hands Bangladesh series win trophy to Akash DeepIndia captain Rohit Sharma handed the Bangladesh Test series trophy to debutant pacer Aakash Deep, honoring his crucial contributions in India's seven-wicket victory, which secured the series despite rain delays in the second Test at Kanpur.

'Mentor' Jasprit Bumrah happy to help Akash Deep: 'He has a lot of heart'Star India pacer Jasprit Bumrah praised Akash Deep for his spirit after the Kanpur Test match. Bumrah, the senior-most pacer in the team said that he is happy to mentor Akash Deep who is a great asset to India.

Ronaldo scores for Al Nassr on father's birthday: Wish he was alive Cristiano Ronaldo's screamer against Al Rayyan, his 904th career goal, was a tribute to his late father on his birthday, as he dedicated the emotional moment to honor his father's lasting impact on his life.

Fearless India conquer Bangladesh, wet weather in Kanpur Test heist, 2-0 sweepIndia vs Bangladesh: Fearless India stormed to a 2-0 series sweep over Bangladesh, defying wet weather and time constraints in the Kanpur Test. After two rain-hit days, India unleashed a blistering batting display on Day 4 and then a bowling masterclass on Day 5 to secure a 7-wicket win on Tuesday.

After two rain-hit days, India unleashed a blistering batting display on Day 4 and then a bowling masterclass on Day 5 to secure a 7-wicket win on Tuesday.

Irani Cup: Prithvi Shaw fails after Devdutt Padikkal's sensational catch at slipsIrani Cup 2024: Prithvi Shaw failed to trouble the scorers much on Tuesday in Lucknow as the Mumbai opener fell for 4. Devdutt Padikkal took a sensational catch at second slip to ensure Prithvi's stay in the middle did not last longer than seven deliveries.

Watch: Bumrah's dismissal of Mushfiqur gives India upper hand in Kanpur TestJasprit Bumrah's crucial 3/17 spell, including Mushfiqur's dismissal, gave India the upper hand on Day 5, leaving them with just 95 runs to chase for a series win against Bangladesh.

One over is enough for Bumrah: Saba Karim praises pacer's Kanpur heroics Saba Karim praised Jasprit Bumrah's crucial 3/17 spell on Day 5, which put India in command. Bumrah's consistent impact and leadership in India's bowling attack played a vital role in setting up a potential series win.

Delhi Capitals co-owner GMR Group buys majority stake in Hampshire county teamThe co-owners of Delhi Capitals, the GMR Group, bought a majority stake in the Hampshire County cricket team. GMR group owns teams in various Twenty-20 leagues, including the IPL, Women's Premier League, and the SA20.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
